english: to flow; to spread; stream/current; to shed (tears)

etymology.interpretation: Combines the water component to signal meanings related to liquids and flowing, with 㐬 supplying the sound value (historically OC *ru, later liú). Meanings extend from literal movement of water to figurative spreading and the shedding of tears.

parts.english: ancient phonetic component; no common modern standalone meaning

examples.chinese: 河水向东流(河水向東流)。
消息很快流传开来(消息很快流傳開來)。
他激动得流泪了(他激動得流淚了)。
examples.english: He was so moved that he shed tears.
